questions.question: What is the primary role of a Product Manager?
options: To discover a product that is valuable, usable, and feasible
questions.correctAnswer: To discover a product that is valuable, usable, and feasible

questions.question: What does MVP stand for?
questions.correctAnswer: Minimum Viable Product

questions.question: Which framework is commonly used for prioritizing features?
questions.correctAnswer: RICE

questions.question: What is a User Persona?
options: A fictional character created to represent a user type
questions.correctAnswer: A fictional character created to represent a user type

questions.question: What is A/B Testing?
options: Testing two versions of a product to see which performs better
questions.correctAnswer: Testing two versions of a product to see which performs better

questions.question: What is a 'User Story'?
options: A short description of a feature from the perspective of the user
questions.correctAnswer: A short description of a feature from the perspective of the user

questions.question: Which metric measures customer loyalty?
questions.correctAnswer: NPS (Net Promoter Score)

questions.question: What is a 'Roadmap'?
options: A strategic plan that defines a goal or desired outcome and includes the major steps to reach it
questions.correctAnswer: A strategic plan that defines a goal or desired outcome and includes the major steps to reach it

questions.question: Who are the key stakeholders for a PM?
questions.correctAnswer: Engineering, Design, Sales, Marketing, Customers

questions.question: What is 'Churn Rate'?
options: The percentage of customers who stop using a product during a given time period
questions.correctAnswer: The percentage of customers who stop using a product during a given time period

questions.question: What is the 'MoSCoW' method?
options: Must have, Should have, Could have, Won't have
questions.correctAnswer: Must have, Should have, Could have, Won't have

questions.question: What is 'Product-Market Fit'?
options: Being in a good market with a product that can satisfy that market
Fitting the product in a box
questions.correctAnswer: Being in a good market with a product that can satisfy that market

questions.question: What is a 'Wireframe'?
options: A visual guide that represents the skeletal framework of a website
questions.correctAnswer: A visual guide that represents the skeletal framework of a website

questions.question: Difference between Waterfall and Agile?
options: Waterfall is sequential/linear, Agile is iterative/incremental
questions.correctAnswer: Waterfall is sequential/linear, Agile is iterative/incremental

questions.question: What is 'CAC'?
questions.correctAnswer: Customer Acquisition Cost

questions.question: What is 'LTV'?
questions.correctAnswer: Lifetime Value

questions.question: What is a 'Sprint' in Scrum?
options: A set period of time during which specific work has to be completed
questions.correctAnswer: A set period of time during which specific work has to be completed

questions.question: What is 'Success Criteria'?
options: The benchmarks that determine whether a product or project has been successful
questions.correctAnswer: The benchmarks that determine whether a product or project has been successful

questions.question: What is 'Technical Debt'?
options: The implied cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now instead of using a better approach that would take longer
questions.correctAnswer: The implied cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now instead of using a better approach that would take longer

questions.question: What is a 'KPI'?
questions.correctAnswer: Key Performance Indicator

questions.question: What is 'Scope Creep'?
options: Uncontrolled growth in a project's scope
questions.correctAnswer: Uncontrolled growth in a project's scope

questions.question: What is 'Design Thinking'?
options: A non-linear, iterative process used to understand users and solve problems
questions.correctAnswer: A non-linear, iterative process used to understand users and solve problems

questions.question: What is a 'Backlog'?
options: A list of tasks required to support a larger strategic plan
questions.correctAnswer: A list of tasks required to support a larger strategic plan

questions.question: What is 'Market Segmentation'?
options: Dividing a target market into smaller, more defined categories
questions.correctAnswer: Dividing a target market into smaller, more defined categories

questions.question: What does 'DAU' stand for?
questions.correctAnswer: Daily Active Users

questions.question: What is the 'Kano Model'?
options: A theory for product development and customer satisfaction
questions.correctAnswer: A theory for product development and customer satisfaction

questions.question: Calculate 'ROI'.
questions.correctAnswer: (Net Profit / Cost of Investment) x 100

questions.question: What is 'Cohort Analysis'?
options: Analyzing the behavior of a group of users who share a common characteristic over time
questions.correctAnswer: Analyzing the behavior of a group of users who share a common characteristic over time

questions.question: What is the difference between 'Output' vs 'Outcome'?
options: Output is what you build (features), Outcome is the value created (behavior change)
Output is money, Outcome is product
Output is code, Outcome is bugs
questions.correctAnswer: Output is what you build (features), Outcome is the value created (behavior change)

questions.question: What is 'Opportunity Cost'?
options: The loss of potential gain from other alternatives when one alternative is chosen
questions.correctAnswer: The loss of potential gain from other alternatives when one alternative is chosen

questions.question: What is a 'North Star Metric'?
options: The single metric that best captures the core value your product delivers to its customers
The number of stars on App Store
questions.correctAnswer: The single metric that best captures the core value your product delivers to its customers

questions.question: How do you calculate 'Viral Coefficient'?
options: Number of invites sent per user * Conversion rate of invites
questions.correctAnswer: Number of invites sent per user * Conversion rate of invites

questions.question: What is 'Dogfooding'?
questions.correctAnswer: Using your own product internally

questions.question: What is 'Cross-Functional Team'?
options: A group of people with different functional expertise working toward a common goal
questions.correctAnswer: A group of people with different functional expertise working toward a common goal

questions.question: What is 'GTM Strategy'?
questions.correctAnswer: Go-to-Market Strategy

questions.question: What is 'Jobs to be Done' (JTBD) framework?
options: Focuses on the job the customer is hiring the product to do
questions.correctAnswer: Focuses on the job the customer is hiring the product to do

questions.question: What is 'Product Discovery'?
options: The process of determining 'what' to build
questions.correctAnswer: The process of determining 'what' to build

questions.question: What is 'Total Addressable Market' (TAM)?
options: The total market demand for a product or service
The number of addresses in a database
questions.correctAnswer: The total market demand for a product or service

questions.question: What is 'Velocity' in Scrum?
options: The amount of work a team can tackle during a single Sprint
questions.correctAnswer: The amount of work a team can tackle during a single Sprint

questions.question: What is 'Feature Creep'?
options: Continuous addition of new features beyond the original scope
questions.correctAnswer: Continuous addition of new features beyond the original scope
